Author: CryptoFoxGaming#5228
Content: Yeah, I am trying to understand its connection to zstratum though.

Author: CryptoFoxGaming#5228
Content:
Ah, I see what happened. The zstratum protocol was put into ZCash Improvement Proposal (ZIP) 301 and was eventually accepted as the standard stratum protocol for all ZCash pools.

Because it was standard for ZCash, they just went back to calling it stratum.

Author: CryptoFoxGaming#5228
Content: In other words, any fork of z-nomp should already use it.

Content:
Huh, very interesting, my average sols/second has dropped when I added CPU mining on top of my GPU. My max is higher but my average dropped significantly.

Author: CryptoFoxGaming#5228
Content:
@webworker01, I am not too worried about power consumption at the moment.

I am more of an investor than a miner and I am willing to take a small loss now to maximize the amount of PIRATE in my wallet later.

I already have my GTX 1060 and mostly use it for streaming. Mining part time seems like a good way to get some extra PIRATE.

I am basically only paying for the wear and tear on the card and since I didn't buy it for this purpose, I don't consider it an up front cost.

I am expecting PIRATE to be worth much more a year or two from now and make up for the extra electricity costs. However, some clocking changes may help.

Author: CryptoFoxGaming#5228
Content: The CEX could implement mantissa association to prove they sent funds. If someone says "you never sent the funds to me," then, if the CEX has their viewing key published, they can say "we received this much on this date, publish your viewing key to prove we didn't send it." Then they can say "see, you received this exact amount down to the 8th decimal place."

Author: CryptoFoxGaming#5228
Content: Yes. It reveals the recipient as it is published by the recipient and is derived from the recipient's private key.
